title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 220-3.5 - Emissions from Aggregate Dryer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 220-3.5 - Emissions from Aggregate Dryer

State Regulations
(a) Owners
or operators of new asphalt mixture processing units subject to the
requirements of this Subpart are no longer permitted to install parallel-flow
aggregate dryer units where the aggregate and hot gas stream flow in the same
direction. (b) Upon becoming
applicable to this Subpart in accordance with section 220-3.1(a)(2), the owner
or operator of an existing or new aggregate dryer shall comply with the
respective emission limits specified in Table 1 for Batch Mix and Continuous

Drum Mix processes. Compliance with the "New Unit Emission Limits" for Nitrogen

Oxides is required for existing units only when the burner is replaced. Compliance with the "New Unit Emission Limits" for Particulate Matter is
required for existing units only when the baghouse is replaced. Replacement of
other equipment or installation of control devices (other than a burner or
baghouse) does not require that the "New Unit Emission Limits" in Table 1 be
attained for the Asphalt Mixture Processing Unit. Table 1 - Aggregate Dryer Emission Limits. Fuel Type

The

that fires waste oil must meet the applicable requirements of 6 NYCRR Subpart
